tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  source_ip VARCHAR(255),
  destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  protocol VARCHAR(50),
  packet_size INT
)

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    port_number INT,
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    data_transferred BIGINT
);

CREATE TABLE security_threats (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    threat_type VARCHAR(100),
    description TEXT,
    detection_time TIMESTAMP,
    severity_level INT
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    packet_size INT
);

CREATE TABLE security_events (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_type VARCHAR(255),
    event_description TEXT,
    event_time TIMESTAMP,
    severity INT
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    source_ip INET,
    destination_ip INET,
    protocol VARCHAR(10),
    port INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE security_threats (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    threat_type VARCHAR(100),
    threat_description TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (threat_type) REFERENCES network_traffic_data(protocol)
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    anomaly_type VARCHAR(100),
    anomaly_description TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (anomaly_type) REFERENCES network_traffic_data(protocol)
)

CREATE TABLE user_devices (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    last_login TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(100),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    role VARCHAR(50)
)
